Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Input value
Returns

The exponential value of the input

Natural Logarithmic Functions

These functions compute the natural logarithmic value of an input value. The input value must be greater than zero.

Andes DSP library supports distinct functions for the following data types: single-, half-, and double-precision floating-point, Q31, and Q15. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_dsp_log_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_dsp_log_f32 (float32_t src)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Input value
Returns

The natural logarithmic value of the input

riscv_dsp_log_f16

Declaration
float16_t riscv_dsp_log_f16 (float16_t src)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Input value
Returns

The natural logarithmic value of the input

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains with HW FPU support. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both the compiler and linker flags for applications that use this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_dsp_log_f64

Declaration
float64_t riscv_dsp_log_f64 (float64_t src)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Input value
Returns

The natural logarithmic value of the input

riscv_dsp_log_q31

Declaration
q31_t riscv_dsp_log_q31 (q31_t src)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Input value
Returns

The natural logarithmic value of the input

riscv_dsp_log_q15

Declaration
q15_t riscv_dsp_log_q15 (q15_t src)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Input value
Returns

The natural logarithmic value of the input

Sigmoid Functions

These functions compute the sigmoid value of the input value.

Andes DSP library supports distinct functions for the following data types: single- and half-precision floating-point data types. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_dsp_sigmoid_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_dsp_sigmoid_f32 (float32_t src)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Input value
Returns

The sigmoid value of the input

riscv_dsp_sigmoid_f16

Declaration
float16_t riscv_dsp_sigmoid_f16 (float16_t src)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Input value
Returns

The sigmoid value of the input

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains with HW FPU support. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both the compiler and linker flags for applications that use this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Inverse Function

This function calculates the inverse value of elements of a source vector and stores the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

Andes DSP library only supports functions in the half-precision floating-point data type.

riscv_dsp_inv_f16

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_inv_f16 (float16_t * src, float16_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains with HW FPU support. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both the compiler and linker flags for applications that use this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Support Vector Machine (SVM) Estimation Functions

This set of functions implements two-class SVM classification based on the specified instance structure.

Andes DSP library supports distinct SVM classification algorithms for the following data types: single- and half-precision floating-point. These functions are described in the subsections below.

SVM Linear Estimation Functions

This section describes the SVM linear estimation functions.

riscv_dsp_svm_linear_est_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_svm_linear_est_f32 (const riscv_dsp_svm_linear_f32_t * instance, const float32_t * src, int32_t * result)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_svm_linear_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 SVM linear estimator, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t numofvec;
    uint32_t dimofvec;
    float32_t intercept;
    const float32_t * dualcoe;
    const float32_t * vec;
    const int32_t * classes;
} riscv_dsp_svm_linear_f32_t;

where:

numofvec

Number of support vectors

dimofvec

Dimension of vector space

intercept

Intercept

dualcoe

Pointer to the dual coefficients

vec

Pointer to the support vectors

classes

Pointer to the 2 classes of SVM

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] result

Pointer to the output decision class
Returns

None

Example
#define numofvec     3
#define dimofvec     4
#define intercept    0.1
float32_t src[dimofvec] = {1.0, 0.5, 0.4, -0.1};
float32_t dualcoe[numofvec] = {0.40, 0.10, 0.24};
float32_t vec[dimofvec * numofvec] = {0.40, 0.10, 0.24, -0.40, -0.34, 0.20, 0.06, 0.28, -0.04, -0.20, 0.08, 0.40};
int32_t classes[2] = {3, 7};
int32_t * result;
riscv_dsp_svm_linear_f32_t instance = {numofvec, dimofvec, intercept, dualcoe, vec, classes};
riscv_dsp_svm_linear_est_f32 (&instance, src, result);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of the F16 SVM Linear estimation function.

riscv_dsp_svm_linear_est_f16

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_svm_linear_est_f16 (const riscv_dsp_svm_linear_f16_t * instance, const float16_t * src, int32_t * result)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_svm_linear_f16_t

Instance structure of the F16 SVM linear estimator, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t numofvec;
    uint32_t dimofvec;
    float16_t intercept;
    const float16_t * dualcoe;
    const float16_t * vec;
    const int32_t * classes;
} riscv_dsp_svm_linear_f16_t;

where:

numofvec

Number of support vectors

dimofvec

Dimension of vector space

intercept

Intercept

dualcoe

Pointer to the dual coefficients

vec

Pointer to the support vectors

classes

Pointer to the 2 classes of SVM

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] result

Pointer to the output decision class
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains with HW FPU support. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both the compiler and linker flags for applications that use this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

SVM Radial Basis Function (RBF) Estimation Functions

This section describes the SVM radial basis function estimation functions.

riscv_dsp_svm_rbf_est_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_svm_rbf_est_f32 (const riscv_dsp_svm_rbf_f32_t * instance, const float32_t * src, int32_t * result)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_svm_rbf_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 SVM RBF estimator, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t numofvec;
    uint32_t dimofvec;
    float32_t intercept;
    const float32_t * dualcoe;
    const float32_t * vec;
    const int32_t * classes;
    float32_t gamma;
} riscv_dsp_svm_rbf_f32_t;

where:

numofvec

Number of support vectors

dimofvec

Dimension of vector space

intercept

Intercept

dualcoe

Pointer to the dual coefficients

vec

Pointer to the support vectors

classes

Pointer to the 2 classes of SVM

gamma

Gamma factor

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] result

Pointer to the output decision class
Returns

None

Example
#define numofvec     3
#define dimofvec     4
#define intercept    0.1
#define gamma        0.2
float32_t src[dimofvec] = {1.0, 0.5, 0.4, -0.1};
float32_t dualcoe[numofvec] = {0.40, 0.10, 0.24};
float32_t vec[dimofvec * numofvec] = {0.40, 0.10, 0.24, -0.40, -0.34, 0.20, 0.06, 0.28, -0.04, -0.20, 0.08, 0.40};
int32_t classes[2] = {2, 5};
int32_t * result;
riscv_dsp_svm_rbf_f32_t instance = {numofvec, dimofvec, intercept, dualcoe, vec, classes, gamma};
riscv_dsp_svm_rbf_est_f32 (&instance, src, result);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of the F16 SVM RBF estimation function.

riscv_dsp_svm_rbf_est_f16

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_svm_rbf_est_f16 (const riscv_dsp_svm_rbf_f16_t * instance, const float16_t * src, int32_t * result)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_svm_rbf_f16_t

Instance structure of the F16 SVM RBF estimator, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t numofvec;
    uint32_t dimofvec;
    float16_t intercept;
    const float16_t * dualcoe;
    const float16_t * vec;
    const int32_t * classes;
    float16_t gamma;
} riscv_dsp_svm_rbf_f16_t;

where:

numofvec

Number of support vectors

dimofvec

Dimension of vector space

intercept

Intercept

dualcoe

Pointer to the dual coefficients

vec

Pointer to the support vectors

classes

Pointer to the 2 classes of SVM

gamma

Gamma factor

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] result

Pointer to the output decision class
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains with HW FPU support. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both the compiler and linker flags for applications that use this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

SVM Polynomial Estimation Functions

This section describes the SVM polynomial estimation functions.

riscv_dsp_svm_poly_est_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_svm_poly_est_f32 (const riscv_dsp_svm_poly_f32_t * instance, const float32_t * src, int32_t * result)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_svm_poly_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 SVM polynomial estimator, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t numofvec;
    uint32_t dimofvec;
    float32_t intercept;
    const float32_t * dualcoe;
    const float32_t * vec;
    const int32_t * classes;
    int32_t exponent;
    float32_t coef0;
    float32_t gamma;
} riscv_dsp_svm_poly_f32_t;

where:

numofvec

Number of support vectors

dimofvec

Dimension of vector space

intercept

Intercept

dualcoe

Pointer to the dual coefficients

vec

Pointer to the support vectors

classes

Pointer to the 2 classes of SVM

exponent

Polynomial exponent

coef0

Independent constant

gamma

Gamma factor

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] result

Pointer to the output decision class
Returns

None

Example
#define numofvec     3
#define dimofvec     4
#define intercept    0.1
#define gamma        0.2
#define exponent     3
#define coef0        0.3
float32_t src[dimofvec] = {1.0, 0.5, 0.4, -0.1};
float32_t dualcoe[numofvec] = {0.40, 0.10, 0.24};
float32_t vec[dimofvec * numofvec] = {0.40, 0.10, 0.24, -0.40, -0.34, 0.20, 0.06, 0.28, -0.04, -0.20, 0.08, 0.40};
int32_t classes[2] = {-1, 4};
int32_t * result;
riscv_dsp_svm_poly_f32_t instance = {numofvec, dimofvec, intercept, dualcoe, vec, classes, exponent, coef0, gamma};
riscv_dsp_svm_poly_est_f32 (&instance, src, result);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of the F16 SVM polynomial estimation function.

riscv_dsp_svm_poly_est_f16

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_svm_poly_est_f16 (const riscv_dsp_svm_poly_f16_t * instance, const float16_t * src, int32_t * result)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_svm_poly_f16_t

Instance structure of the F16 SVM polynomial estimator , defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t numofvec;
    uint32_t dimofvec;
    float16_t intercept;
    const float16_t * dualcoe;
    const float16_t * vec;
    const int32_t * classes;
    int32_t exponent;
    float16_t coef0;
    float16_t gamma;
} riscv_dsp_svm_poly_f16_t;

where:

numofvec

Number of support vectors

dimofvec

Dimension of vector space

intercept

Intercept

dualcoe

Pointer to the dual coefficients

vec

Pointer to the support vectors

classes

Pointer to the 2 classes of SVM

exponent

Polynomial exponent

coef0

Independent constant

gamma

Gamma factor

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] result

Pointer to the output decision class
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains with HW FPU support. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both the compiler and linker flags for applications that use this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

SVM Sigmoid Estimation Functions

This section describes the SVM sigmoid estimation functions.

riscv_dsp_svm_sigmoid_est_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_svm_sigmoid_est_f32 (const riscv_dsp_svm_sigmoid_f32_t * instance, const float32_t * src, int32_t * result)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_svm_sigmoid_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 SVM sigmoid estimator, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t numofvec;
    uint32_t dimofvec;
    float32_t intercept;
    const float32_t * dualcoe;
    const float32_t * vec;
    const int32_t * classes;
    float32_t coef0;
    float32_t gamma;
} riscv_dsp_svm_sigmoid_f32_t;

where:

numofvec

Number of support vectors

dimofvec

Dimension of vector space

intercept

Intercept

dualcoe

Pointer to the dual coefficients

vec

Pointer to the support vectors

classes

Pointer to the 2 classes of SVM

coef0

Independent constant

gamma

Gamma factor

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] result

Pointer to the output decision class
Returns

None

Example
#define numofvec     3
#define dimofvec     4
#define intercept    0.1
#define gamma        0.2
#define coef0        0.3

float32_t dualcoe[numofvec] = {0.40, 0.10, 0.24};
float32_t vec[dimofvec * numofvec] = {0.40, 0.10, 0.24, -0.40, -0.34, 0.20, 0.06, 0.28, -0.04, -0.20, 0.08, 0.40};
int32_t classes[2] = {-1, 4};
int32_t * result;

This example also serves as a reference for examples of the F16 SVM sigmoid estimation function.

riscv_dsp_svm_sigmoid_est_f16

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_svm_sigmoid_est_f16 (const riscv_dsp_svm_sigmoid_f16_t * instance, const float16_t * src, int32_t * result)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_svm_sigmoid_f16_t

Instance structure of the F16 SVM sigmoid estimator, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t numofvec;
    uint32_t dimofvec;
    float16_t intercept;
    const float16_t * dualcoe;
    const float16_t * vec;
    const int32_t * classes;
    float16_t coef0;
    float16_t gamma;

numofvec

Number of support vectors

dimofvec

Dimension of vector space

intercept

Intercept

dualcoe

Pointer to the dual coefficients

vec

Pointer to the support vectors

classes

Pointer to the 2 classes of SVM

coef0

Independent constant

gamma

Gamma factor

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] result

Pointer to the output decision class
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains with HW FPU support. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both the compiler and linker flags for applications that use this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Distance Functions

These functions compute the distance between two vectors.

Andes DSP library supports distinct distance functions for the following data types: single- and half-precision floating-point and Boolean values. These functions are described in the subsections below.

Float Distance Functions

These functions compute the distance between two vectors of float values.

The following example applies to all Andes float distance functions except riscv_dsp_dist_minkowski_f32 and riscv_dsp_dist_minkowski_f16. For the reference example of the two functions, see riscv_dsp_dist_minkowski_f32.

#define size    4
float32_t src1[size] = {1.0, 0.5, 0.4, -0.1};
float32_t src2[size] = {0.40, -0.2, 0.24, 0.4};
float32_t dist_out;
dist_out = riscv_dsp_dist_bray_curtis_f32 (src1, src2, size);
dist_out = riscv_dsp_dist_canberra_f32 (src1, src2, size);
dist_out = riscv_dsp_dist_chebyshev_f32 (src1, src2, size);
dist_out = riscv_dsp_dist_city_block_f32 (src1, src2, size);
dist_out = riscv_dsp_dist_corr_f32 (src1, src2, size);
dist_out = riscv_dsp_dist_cos_f32 (src1, src2, size);
dist_out = riscv_dsp_dist_euclidean_f32 (src1, src2, size);
dist_out = riscv_dsp_dist_jensen_shannon_f32 (src1, src2, size);

riscv_dsp_dist_bray_curtis_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_dsp_dist_bray_curtis_f32 (const float32_t * src1, const float32_t * src2, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The distance value

riscv_dsp_dist_bray_curtis_f16

Declaration
float16_t riscv_dsp_dist_bray_curtis_f16 (const float16_t * src1, const float16_t * src2, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The distance value

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains with HW FPU support. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both the compiler and linker flags for applications that use this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_dsp_dist_jensen_shannon_f32

[in] src2

Returns

The distance value

riscv_dsp_dist_jensen_shannon_f16

Declaration
float16_t riscv_dsp_dist_jensen_shannon_f16 (const float16_t * src1, const float16_t * src2, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The distance value

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains with HW FPU support. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both the compiler and linker flags for applications that use this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_dsp_dist_minkowski_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_dsp_dist_minkowski_f32 (const float32_t * src1, const float32_t * src2, int32_t order, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] order

Distance order

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The distance value

Example
#define size     4
#define order    3
float32_t src1[size] = {1.0, 0.5, 0.4, -0.1};
float32_t src2[size] = {0.40, -0.2, 0.24, 0.4};
float32_t dist_out;
dist_out = riscv_dsp_dist_minkowski_f32 (src1, src2, order, size);

riscv_dsp_dist_minkowski_f16

Declaration
float16_t riscv_dsp_dist_minkowski_f16 (const float16_t * src1, const float16_t * src2, int32_t order, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] order

Distance order

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The distance value

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains with HW FPU support. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both the compiler and linker flags for applications that use this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Boolean Distance Functions

These functions compute the distance between two vectors of Boolean values. Each Boolean value is stored as 1 bit and packed in a 32-bit word from the most significant bit (MSB).

The following example applies to all Andes Boolean distance functions. It shows how to pack 120 Boolean numbers into four 32-bit big-endian words for use with the desired Boolean distance function. The first three words each store 32 Boolean values, while the fourth word stores the remaining 24 values in its MSB. Bits 0 to 7 of the fourth word are treated as “don’t care.”

Example
#define numofbool    120
uint32_t src1[4] = {0x12322111, 0x24421111, 0x012ff241, 0x33c31100};
uint32_t src2[4] = {0x22222222, 0x11ea3222, 0x13465648, 0x5b351100};
float32_t dist_out;
dist_out = riscv_dsp_bdist_dice_u32_f32 (src1, src2, numofbool);
dist_out = riscv_dsp_bdist_hamming_u32_f32 (src1, src2, numofbool);
dist_out = riscv_dsp_bdist_jaccard_u32_f32 (src1, src2, numofbool);
dist_out = riscv_dsp_bdist_kulsinski_u32_f32 (src1, src2, numofbool);
dist_out = riscv_dsp_bdist_rogers_tanimoto_u32_f32 (src1, src2, numofbool);
dist_out = riscv_dsp_bdist_russell_rao_u32_f32 (src1, src2, numofbool);
dist_out = riscv_dsp_bdist_sokal_michener_u32_f32 (src1, src2, numofbool);
dist_out = riscv_dsp_bdist_sokal_sneath_u32_f32 (src1, src2, numofbool);
dist_out = riscv_dsp_bdist_yule_u32_f32 (src1, src2, numofbool);

riscv_dsp_bdist_dice_u32_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_dsp_bdist_dice_u32_f32 (const uint32_t * src1, const uint32_t * src2, uint32_t numofbool)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] numofbool

Number of booleans in a vector
Returns

The distance value

riscv_dsp_bdist_hamming_u32_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_dsp_bdist_hamming_u32_f32 (const uint32_t * src1, const uint32_t * src2, uint32_t numofbool)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] numofbool

Number of booleans in a vector
Returns

The distance value

riscv_dsp_bdist_jaccard_u32_f32

Number of booleans in a vector
Returns

The distance value

Dynamic Time Warping (DTW) Distance Functions

These functions compute the DTW distance between the input F32 distance matrix and input Q7 window matrix, which can be NULL (representing a full-range computation) or a result computed from riscv_dsp_dtw_init_window_q7. Additionally, it can compute the DTW path using riscv_dsp_dtw_path_f32.

riscv_dsp_dtw_distance_f32

Declaration
int riscv_dsp_dtw_distance_f32 (const float32_t * dtw_src, const q7_t * dtw_window, float32_t * dtw_out, float32_t * dtw_distance, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] dtw_src

Pointer to the input distance matrix

[in] dtw_window

Pointer to the input window matrix

[out] dtw_out

Pointer to the output DTW cost matrix

[out] dtw_distance

Pointer to the output DTW distance

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • 0 if successful

  • -1 if no path can be found due to window constraints

riscv_dsp_int_window_q7

Declaration
int riscv_dsp_int_window_q7 (const window_type, const int32_t window_size, q7_t * dtw_window, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] window_type

Type of the window

[in] window_size

Size of the window

[out] dtw_window

Pointer to the output window matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • 0 if successful

  • -1 if window_type is not supported

Note

Supported window types for window_type include:

RISCV_DSP_DTW_SAKOE_CHIBA_WINDOW

SAKOE_CHIBA window type

RISCV_DSP_DTW_SLANTED_BAND_WINDOW

SLANTED_BAND window type

riscv_dsp_dtw_path_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_dtw_path_f32 (const float32_t * dtw, int16_t * dtw_path, uint32_t * dtw_path_length, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] dtw

Pointer to the input DTW cost matrix

[out] dtw_path

Pointer to the output DTW path vector

[out] dtw_path_length

Pointer to the output path length

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

None

Sorting Functions

This section describes the sorting functions.

Generic Sorting Functions

These functions sort elements of a vector by the algorithm and the sorting order specified in the instance structure. The algorithms available for performing generic sorting include bitonic sort, bubble sort, heap sort, insertion sort, quick sort, and selection sort.

Andes DSP library only supports functions for the single-precision floating-point data type. These functions and their instance structure are described in the subsections below.

riscv_dsp_sort_init_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_sort_init_f32 (riscv_dsp_sort_f32_t * instance, riscv_dsp_sort_alg alg, riscv_dsp_sort_order order)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_sort_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 generic sorting, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    riscv_dsp_sort_alg alg;
    riscv_dsp_sort_order order;
} riscv_dsp_sort_f32_t;

where:

alg

Desired sorting algorithm

order

Desired sorting order

[in, out] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] alg

Desired sorting algorithm

[in] order

Desired sorting order
Note

  • Call this function to initialize the instance structure before executing the riscv_dsp_sort_f32 function. See riscv_dsp_sort_f32 for code examples.

  • Supported sorting algorithms for generic sorting (i.e., options for alg) include:

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_BITONIC

    Bitonic sort

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_BUBBLE

    Bubble sort

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_HEAP

    Heap sort

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_INSERTION

    Insertion sort

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_QUICK

    Quick sort

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_SELECTION

    Selection sort

  • Supported sorting orders for generic sorting (i.e., options for order) include:

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_DESCENDING

    Descending order

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_ASCENDING

    Ascending order

riscv_dsp_sort_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_sort_f32 (const riscv_dsp_sort_f32_t * instance, float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_sort_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 generic sorting, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    riscv_dsp_sort_alg alg;
    riscv_dsp_sort_order order;
} riscv_dsp_sort_f32_t;

where:

alg

Desired sorting algorithm

order

Desired sorting order

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Note

  • Supported sorting algorithms for generic sorting (i.e., options for alg) include:

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_BITONIC

    Bitonic sort

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_BUBBLE

    Bubble sort

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_HEAP

    Heap sort

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_INSERTION

    Insertion sort

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_QUICK

    Quick sort

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_SELECTION

    Selection sort

  • Supported sorting orders for generic sorting (i.e., options for order) include:

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_DESCENDING

    Descending order

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_ASCENDING

    Ascending order

  • To ensure correct results, call the riscv_dsp_sort_init_f32 function to initialize the instance structure before executing this function. For usage of the two functions, see the code example below.

Example

Given an input size of 100, a sorting order of ascending, and a sorting algorithm of quick sort, the following code example demonstrates generic sorting:

#define size    100
riscv_dsp_sort_f32_t instance;
float32_t src[size] = {...};
float32_t dst[size];
riscv_dsp_sort_init_f32 (&instance, RISCV_DSP_SORT_QUICK, RISCV_DSP_SORT_ASCENDING);
riscv_dsp_sort_f32 (&instance, src, dst, size);

Merge Sorting Functions

These functions sort the elements of a vector by the sorting order specified in the instance structure using a divide-and-conquer algorithm. This algorithm divides the input array into sublists, sorts them, and merges them into progressively larger sorted sublists until a single sorted list remains. A buffer is required by the algorithm to store the intermediate results.

Andes DSP library only supports functions for the single-precision floating-point data type. These functions and their instance structure are described in the subsections below.

riscv_dsp_sort_merge_init_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_sort_merge_init_f32 (riscv_dsp_sort_merge_f32_t * instance, riscv_dsp_sort_order order, float32_t * buf)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_sort_merge_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 merge sorting, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    riscv_dsp_sort_order order;
    float32_t * buf;
} riscv_dsp_sort_f32_t;

where:

order

Desired sorting order

buf

Pointer to the working buffer whose size is size

[in, out] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] order

Desired sorting order

[in] buf

Pointer to the working buffer whose size is size
Note

  • Call this function to initialize the instance structure before executing the riscv_dsp_sort_merge_f32 function. See riscv_dsp_sort_merge_f32 for code examples.

  • Supported sorting orders for merge sorting (i.e., options for order) include:

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_DESCENDING

    Descending order

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_ASCENDING

    Ascending order

riscv_dsp_sort_merge_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_sort_merge_f32 (const riscv_dsp_sort_merge_f32_t * instance, float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_sort_merge_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 merge sorting, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    riscv_dsp_sort_order order;
    float32_t * buf;
} riscv_dsp_sort_f32_t;

where:

order

Desired sorting order

buf

Pointer to the working buffer whose size is size

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Note

  • Supported sorting orders for merge sorting (i.e., options for order) include:

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_DESCENDING

    Descending order

    RISCV_DSP_SORT_ASCENDING

    Ascending order

  • To ensure correct results, call the riscv_dsp_sort_merge_init_f32 function to initialize the instance structure before executing this function. For usage of the two functions, see the code example below.

Example

Given an input size of 100, a sorting order of descending, the following code example demonstrates merge sorting:

#define size    100
riscv_dsp_sort_merge_f32_t instance;
float32_t src[size] = {...};
float32_t buf[size];
float32_t dst[size];
riscv_dsp_sort_merge_init_f32 (&instance, RISCV_DSP_SORT_DESCENDING, buf);
riscv_dsp_sort_merge_f32 (&instance, src, dst, size);

Interpolation Functions

This section includes the following interpolation functions.

Linear Interpolation Functions

Linear interpolation is a method of curve fitting using linear polynomials. Linear interpolation works by effectively drawing a straight line between two neighboring samples and returning the appropriate point along that line.

Andes DSP library supports distinct functions for the following data types: single- and half-precision floating-point, Q31, Q15, and Q7. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_dsp_linear_interp_f32

Declaration
int riscv_dsp_linear_interp_f32 (riscv_dsp_linear_interp_f32_t * instance, float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_linear_interp_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 linear interpolation, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t tbl_size;
    float32_t first_x;
    float32_t x_spacing;
    const float32_t * tbl_data;
} riscv_dsp_linear_interp_f32_t;

where:

tbl_size

Number of table size

first_x

First x of the table

x_spacing

X-axis spacing

tbl_data

Pointer to the table data

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

0

riscv_dsp_linear_interp_f16

Declaration
int riscv_dsp_linear_interp_f16 (riscv_dsp_linear_interp_f16_t * instance, float16_t * src, float16_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_linear_interp_f16_t

Instance structure of the F16 linear interpolation, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t tbl_size;
    float16_t first_x;
    float16_t x_spacing;
    const float16_t * tbl_data;
} riscv_dsp_linear_interp_f16_t;

where:

tbl_size

Number of table size

first_x

First x of the table

x_spacing

X-axis spacing

tbl_data

Pointer to the table data

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

0

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains with HW FPU support. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both the compiler and linker flags for applications that use this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_dsp_linear_interp_q31

where:

Pointer to the table data

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

[out] dst

0

riscv_dsp_linear_interp_q7

Declaration
int riscv_dsp_linear_interp_q7 (riscv_dsp_linear_interp_q7_t * instance, q31_t * src, q7_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_linear_interp_q7_t

Instance structure of the Q7 linear interpolation, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t tbl_size;
    const q7_t * tbl_data;
} riscv_dsp_linear_interp_q7_t;

where:

tbl_size

Number of table size

tbl_data

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

0

Bilinear Interpolation Functions

Bilinear interpolation is an extension of linear interpolation applied to a two-dimensional grid. The underlying function f(x, y) is sampled on a regular grid and the interpolation process determines the values between the grid points.

Bilinear interpolation is equivalent to two-step linear interpolation, first in the X-dimension and then in the Y-dimension.

Andes DSP library supports distinct functions for the following data types: single- and half-precision floating-point, Q31, Q15, and Q7. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_f32

Declaration
int riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_f32 (riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_f32_t * instance, float32_t * src_x, float32_t * src_y, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 bilinear interpolation, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t row;
    uint32_t col;
    const float32_t * tbl_data;
} riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_f32_t;

where:

row

Number of rows in table data

col

Number of columns in table data

tbl_data

Pointer to the table data

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src_x

Pointer to the input X coordinate vector

[in] src_y

Pointer to the input Y coordinate vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

0

riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_f16

Declaration
int riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_f16 (riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_f16_t * instance, float16_t * src_x, float16_t * src_y, float16_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_f16_t

Instance structure of the F16 bilinear interpolation, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t row;
    uint32_t col;
    const float16_t * tbl_data;
} riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_f16_t;

where:

row

Number of rows in table data

col

Number of columns in table data

tbl_data

Pointer to the table data

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src_x

Pointer to the input X coordinate vector

[in] src_y

Pointer to the input Y coordinate vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

0

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains with HW FPU support. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both the compiler and linker flags for applications that use this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_q31

Declaration
int riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_q31 (riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_q31_t * instance, q31_t * src_x, q31_t * src_y, q31_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_q31_t

Instance structure of the Q31 bilinear interpolation, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t row;
    uint32_t col;
    const q31_t * tbl_data;
} riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_q31_t;

where:

row

Number of rows in table data

col

Number of columns in table data

tbl_data

Pointer to the table data

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src_x

Pointer to the input X coordinate vector

[in] src_y

Pointer to the input Y coordinate vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

0

riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_q15

Declaration
int riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_q15 (riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_q15_t * instance, q31_t * src_x, q31_t * src_y, q15_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_q15_t

Instance structure of the Q15 bilinear interpolation, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t row;
    uint32_t col;
    const q15_t * tbl_data;
} riscv_dsp_bilinear_interp_q15_t;

where:

row

col

Number of columns in table data

tbl_data

Pointer to the table data

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src_x

Pointer to the input X coordinate vector

[in] src_y

Pointer to the input Y coordinate vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

0

Cubic Spline Interpolation Functions

Spline interpolation is a method of interpolation where the interpolant is a piecewise-defined polynomial called spline.

You can use the riscv_dsp_spline_interp_init_f32 function to calculate the coefficient of spline and call the riscv_dsp_spline_interp_f32 function to get the interpolation result of the input vector.

Andes DSP library only supports functions for the F32 data type. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_dsp_spline_interp_init_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_spline_interp_init_f32 (riscv_dsp_spline_interp_f32_t * instance, riscv_dsp_spline_bound_cond cond, const float32_t * src_x, const float32_t * src_y, uint32_t nsize, float32_t * coeffs, float32_t * tmpbuf)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_spline_interp_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 spline interpolation, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    riscv_dsp_spline_bound_cond cond;
    const float32_t * x;
    const float32_t * y;
    uint32_t num_x;
    float32_t * coeffs;
} riscv_dsp_spline_interp_f32_t;

where:

cond

Type of boundary condition

x

Pointer to the x coordinate known data

y

Pointer to the y coordinate known data

num_x

Number of known data

coeffs

Pointer to coefficient vector

[in, out] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] cond

Type of boundary condition

[in] src_x

Pointer to the x coordinate known data vector

[in] src_y

Pointer to the y coordinate known data vector

[in] nsize

Number of known data points in a vector

[in] coeffs

Pointer to the coefficient vector

[in] tmpbuf

Pointer to the temporary buffer
Returns

None

Note

Supported condition types for riscv_dsp_spline_bound_cond include:

RISCV_DSP_SPLINE_NATURAL

Natural spline condition

RISCV_DSP_SPLINE_PARABOLIC_RUNOUT

Parabolic runout spline condition

riscv_dsp_spline_interp_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_spline_interp_f32 (riscv_dsp_spline_interp_f32_t * instance, const float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_dsp_spline_interp_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 spline interpolation, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    riscv_dsp_spline_bound_cond cond;
    const float32_t * x;
    const float32_t * y;
    uint32_t num_x;
    float32_t * coeffs;
} riscv_dsp_spline_interp_f32_t;

where:

cond

Type of boundary condition

x

Pointer to the x coordinate known data

y

Pointer to the y coordinate known data

num_x

Number of known data

coeffs

Pointer to coefficient vector

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input x value vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

Supported condition types for riscv_dsp_spline_bound_cond include:

RISCV_DSP_SPLINE_NATURAL

Natural spline condition

RISCV_DSP_SPLINE_PARABOLIC_RUNOUT

Parabolic runout spline condition

Quaternion Functions

This section includes the following quaternion functions.

Quaternion Conversion Functions

These functions convert elements between quaternion and rotation representations. Given a quaternion \(\mathtt{q = a + ib + jc + kd}\), the rotation matrix can be derived from:

\[ \mathtt{ \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{a^2 + b^2 - c^2 - d^2} & \mathtt{2bc - 2ad} & \mathtt{2bd + 2ac} \\ \mathtt{2bc + 2ad} & \mathtt{a^2 - b^2 + c^2 - d^2} & \mathtt{2cd - 2ab} \\ \mathtt{2bd - 2ac} & \mathtt{2cd + 2ab} & \mathtt{a^2 - b^2 - c^2 + d^2} \end{bmatrix} } \]

Andes DSP library only supports functions for the F32 data type. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_dsp_quaternion2rotation_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_quaternion2rotation_f32 (const float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input quaternion vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output 3x3 rotations in the row-order vector

[in] size

Number of quaternions in the vector
Returns

None

riscv_dsp_rotation2quaternion_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_rotation2quaternion_f32 (const float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input 3x3 rotations in the row-order vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output quaternion vector

[in] size

Number of quaternions in the vector
Returns

None

Quaternion Conjugate Function

This function computes the conjugate of a quaternion.

The behavior can be defined as follows:

\[ \mathtt{ q^* = a - ib - jc - kd } \]

Andes DSP library only supports the function for the F32 data type. The function is described in the subsection below.

riscv_dsp_quaternion_conj_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_quaternion_conj_f32 (const float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input quaternion vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output quaternion vector

[in] size

Number of quaternions in the vector
Returns

None

Quaternion Inverse Function

This function computes the inverse of a quaternion.

The behavior can be defined as follows:

\[ \mathtt{q^{\scriptscriptstyle{-1}} = \frac{q^{\scriptscriptstyle{*}}}{\|q\|^{\scriptscriptstyle{2}}}} \]

Andes DSP library only supports the function for the F32 data type. The function is described in the subsection below.

riscv_dsp_quaternion_inv_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_quaternion_inv_f32 (const float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input quaternion vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output quaternion vector

[in] size

Number of quaternions in the vector
Returns

None

Quaternion Length (norm) Function

This function computes the length (norm) of a quaternion.

The behavior can be defined as follows:

\[ \mathtt{|q| = \sqrt{a^{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} + b^{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} + c^{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} + d^{\scriptscriptstyle{2}}}} \]

Andes DSP library only supports the function for the F32 data type. The function is described in the subsection below.

riscv_dsp_quaternion_length_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_quaternion_length_f32 (const float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input quaternion vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output quaternion vector

[in] size

Number of quaternions in the vector
Returns

None

Quaternion Normalize Function

This function normalizes a quaternion.

The behavior can be defined as follows:

\[ \mathtt{normalize \, \, q = \frac{q}{|q|}} \]

Andes DSP library only supports the function for the F32 data type. The function is described in the subsection below.

riscv_dsp_quaternion_normalize_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_quaternion_normalize_f32 (const float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input quaternion vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output quaternion vector

[in] size

Number of quaternions in the vector
Returns

None

Quaternion Product Functions

These functions calculate the product of two quaternions, which can represent either single points or vectors.

The behavior can be defined as follows:

\[ \begin{aligned} & \mathtt{product \, q = (a_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}a_{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} - b_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}b_{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} - c_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}c_{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} - d_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}d_{\scriptscriptstyle{2}})} & + \quad \mathtt{i \, (a_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}b_{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} + b_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}a_{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} + c_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}d_{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} - d_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}c_{\scriptscriptstyle{2}})} \\ & \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad + \mathtt{j \, (a_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}c_{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} - b_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}d_{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} + c_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}a_{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} + d_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}b_{\scriptscriptstyle{2}})} & + \quad \mathtt{k \, (a_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}d_{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} + b_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}c_{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} - c_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}b_{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} + d_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}a_{\scriptscriptstyle{2}})} \end{aligned} \]

Andes DSP library supports distinct functions for the F32 data type. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_dsp_quaternion_product_single_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_quaternion_product_single_f32 (const float32_t * src1, const float32_t * src2, float32_t *dst)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input quaternion

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input quaternion

[out] dst

Pointer to the output product of two quaternions
Returns

None

riscv_dsp_quaternion_product_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_quaternion_product_f32 (const float32_t * src1, const float32_t * src2, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input quaternion vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input quaternion vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output product vector

[in] size

Number of quaternions in the vector
Returns

None

Window Functions

Window functions are classified into regular window functions and flat-top window functions.

Regular window functions are used to detect tones or estimate the noise. They can be categorized into the following window types according to their peak sidelobe levels (PSL):

  • Bartlett window (26.5 dB)

  • Blackman Harris window (92 dB)

  • Hamming window (42.7 dB)

  • Hanning window (31.5 dB)

  • Nuttall3 window (46.7 dB)

  • Nuttall3a window (64.2 dB)

  • Nuttall3b window (71.5 dB)

  • Nuttall4 window (60.9 dB)

  • Nuttall4a window (82.6 dB)

  • Nuttall4b window (93.3 dB)

  • Nuttall4c window (98.1 dB)

  • Welch window (21.3 dB)

Flat-top window functions are used to estimate the amplitude of a tone. They can be categorized into the following window types according to their PSL:

  • Hft90d window (90.2 dB)

  • Hft95 window (95.0 dB)

  • Hft116d window (116.8 dB)

  • Hft144d window (144.1 dB)

  • Hft169d window (169.5 dB)

  • Hft196d window (196.2 dB)

  • Hft223d window (223.0 dB)

  • Hft248d window (248.4 dB)

These window types are referenced from Spectrum and spectral density estimation by the Discrete Fourier transform (DFT), including a comprehensive list of window functions and some new flat-top windows by G. Heinzel, A. Rudiger and R. Schilling, Max-Planck-Institut für Gravitationsphysik (Albert-Einstein-Institut), Teilinstitut Hannover.

Bartlett Window Functions

These functions generate the Bartlett window with the following parameters:

Parameter Value

Peak sidelobe level

26.5 dB

Normalized equivalent noise bandwidth

1.3333 bins

3 dB bandwidth

1.2736 bins

Flatness

-1.8242 dB

Recommended overlap

50.0 %

Andes DSP library supports distinct functions for the following data types: single- and double-precision floating-point. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_dsp_win_bartlett_f32

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_win_bartlett_f32 (float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output generated window

[in] size

Number of samples in the window
Returns

None

riscv_dsp_win_bartlett_f64

Declaration
void riscv_dsp_win_bartlett_f64 (float64_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output generated window

[in] size

Number of samples in the window
Returns

None

riscv_dsp_win_welch_f32

Hft90d Window Functions

These functions generate the Hft90d window with the following parameters:

Parameter Value

Peak sidelobe level

90.2 dB

Normalized equivalent noise bandwidth

3.8832 bins

3 dB bandwidth

3.8320 bins

Flatness

-0.0039 dB

Recommended overlap

76.0 %

Andes DSP library supports distinct functions for the following data types: single- and double-precision floating-point. These functions are described in the subsections below.
